main event: Two US Navy pilots reported sighting an unidentified flying object in Tennessee on 1 April 1952, tracking it from 6 miles east of Shelbyville to a point approximately 18 miles southwest of Nashville.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be 30-40 feet in diameter and had a whitish-orange color with a distinct glow or luminosity.
Its speed was estimated at 9 to 14 knots, and it displayed varying altitude, speed, and heading.
No exhaust trail was observed, and it was spotted at an altitude of 3000 to 4000 feet with 1/2 to 1 mile visibility at 15 miles reported by the U.S. Weather Bureau.

On another occasion, a separate incident in Memphis, Tennessee on 14 April 1952, involved a bright inverted bell-shaped object, white in color, making vertical and horizontal movements at an altitude of 5000'.
Several conclusions were provided in the report, including 'Unknown' and 'Insufficient Data for Evaluation', leaving the nature of the sightings unexplained.
witnesses: two US Navy pilots, unidentified ground witnesses
